intro: Fagara camphorata, commonly known as camphor wood or camphor tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, including countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and fruits, which contain compounds such as camphor and other essential oils. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Due to its medicinal and aromatic properties, it has been historically used in traditional medicine and for the production of natural remedies.
